subject: p12595991
History: Year old woman with amio-induced lung injury with worsening hypoxemia, evaluate for interval change, pulmonary edema.
Impression: As compared to the previous radiograph, the previously malpositioned PICC line in the left jugular vein has been pulled back. However, on todays examination, the PICC line appears to project over the right axillary region. The line should be completely withdrawn and repositioned. The previous right internal jugular vein catheter was removed. There is unchanged mild cardiomegaly at lower lung volumes. These low lung volumes are essentially caused by an elevation of the right hemidiaphragm, better appreciated on the lateral than on the frontal radiograph. No current evidence of larger pleural effusions, pulmonary edema, or pneumonia. Unchanged pacemaker leads and left pectoral pacemaker generator.
